default: a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} and a set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice
(a) a {@item studded leather armor|phb} or (b) a {@item scale mail|phb}
a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 {@item crossbow bolt|phb|bolts}
Two {@item tinker's tools|phb} and a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: The Artificer
entries: 一个头发花白的侏儒弯腰在他的工作台前，小心地调整着会驱动他创造物的发条机械。在他面前摆放着一个由精巧铁制齿轮构成的自动人偶，穿着一套铁甲，造型酷似一个巨大的侏儒。当这位微小的发明家将他标志性的秘银胡须固定在面甲上时，一道电蓝色的魔法闪过自动人偶。随着一个犀利的动作，钢铁卫士坐直了，等待着它的创造者的第一个命令。
哥布林小心翼翼地沿着他用有毒烟雾和酸液装置陷阱的隧道前行。这已经是他的部落今年第三次搬迁地洞，以避免被冒险队抢劫，这位富有创造力的哥布林决心保护最新的家园地洞。他相信这一次他会阻止那些总是找到他家的冒险者。
一位年轻的人类女性，身穿精美衣服，外面披着皮围裙，她展示了刚刚附魔过的钢铁护手。当她握紧拳头时，护手释放出一道耀眼的薰衣草色闪电，摧毁了房间对面的桌子。尘埃落定后，她将护手固定在她已经完整的奥术盔甲上。当她向父亲展示这件最新的作品时，他终将不得不表现出对她的认可。

entries.name: Masters of Innovation
entries: 在追求创新方面毫不妥协，制造师们以他们无尽的好奇心和愿意冒险推动奥术发明的极限而著称。对于大多数制造师来说，他们把个人价值寄托在他们实验的成果上，他们认为掌握所选择工艺的基础是通往真正伟大的第一步。
每位制造者的内心深处，目标都是发现一项新的开创性发明，无论是魔法还是其他。有些制造者是工程师，是科学和战争的学生，他们运用自己丰富的智慧来构建用魔法增强的致命武器。另一些人将自己视为艺术家，将奥术魔法的严格公式与自己专业工具和法术的工匠之感相结合。

entries.name: Fierce Rivalries
entries: 几乎每个工匠都有一个对手，往往是另一个工匠，他们努力在每一个转折点超越对方。这种激烈的竞争是一些工匠的唯一动力，超越对手比他们从发现中获得的任何名声或财富更有价值。许多人愿意冒一切去在对手之前取得新突破。
同样地，持有相似理念和目标的铸师们经常会结成松散的工匠行会。他们分享见解和发现，希望通过集中资源和团队合作来保持领先于竞争对手的位置。然而，即使在一起工作时，大多数铸师们也会保护他们认为可能导致突破性发现的任何见解。

entries.name: Creating Your Artificer
entries: 在创建一名铸师时，要考虑他们的背景和对冒险的动力。他们的对手是谁，是什么事件开始了他们的仇恨？你的铸师与教授他们基本工艺的工匠有什么关系？他们是否属于某个行会？铸师在战役世界中扮演什么角色？所有主要城市中是否存在铸师行会，或者你是第一个追求奥术发明之路的人？
最重要的是，你的(`artifice`)是什么样子的？并不是所有的奥术发明者都使用齿轮和润滑油。你的(`artificer`)是一个学习巫婆使用奇异魔法将骨头图腾注入奥术能量的学生吗？或者，你是一个雕刻着精致的精灵符文在木制法杖和长棍上的附魔师吗？

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: 您可以通过以下建议快速创建一名神器师。首先，将智力设为最高能力值，其次是敏捷。其次，选择{@background guild artisan|phb|artisan}背景。第三，选择{@optfeature enhanced defense|LLAART}和{@optfeature repeating shot|LLAART}的灌输。

classFeature.name: Infusions
entries: 你已经学会了用你独特的魔法给物品注入能量，制造出奇妙的物品。在1级时，你可以从本职业末尾列表中选择两个{@filter Infusions|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAART:INF}。制造师表格中的"已掌握的灌输"栏显示了你何时学会更多你选择的灌输。
在一次长休结束时，只要你有工匠工具，你可以用你选择的另一个（Infusion）替换你已知的一个（Infusion），只要你符合它的所有先决条件。

entries.name: Infusing an Object
entries: 在一次长休结束时，你可以使用你的工匠工具将你所知道的一种（Infusion）灌注到一个非魔法物品中。要做到这一点，你必须能够用你的工具触碰这个物品。
如果该灌注物品需要认定，你可以在灌注时立即认定该物品，或者你可以放弃认定，以便另一个生物可以认定它。要稍后认定灌注的物品，你必须遵循正常的认定流程。
灌注物品会永久存在。如果你死亡，那么在过去的天数等于你的智力修正值的天数之后（最少1天），灌注会消失。如果你放弃某个灌注的知识以学习另一个，或者将灌注注入另一个物品，灌注会立即消失。
你可以在每次长休结束时给多个物品灌注能量，每次最多一个对应你所掌握的每个（Infusion）(%num%)。每个（Infusion）(%num%)一次只能在一个物品上，而且一个物品不能承载多个（Infusion）(%num%)。如果你将（Infusion）(%num%)转移到一个新物品上，之前的（Infusion）(%num%)立即结束。

entries.name: Replicate Magic Item
entries: 你也可以利用你的灌注来复制你研究过的魔法物品。在一次长休的过程中，你可以使用工匠工具来检查一个你能触摸到的魔法物品。在那次长休结束时，你可以用这个魔法物品的知识来替换你已知的灌注之一。之后，你可以将一个物品灌注上那个魔法物品的属性，遵循所有其他灌注的规则。
你可以使用这个特性来复制任何一件普通稀有度的物品。随着你获得铁匠等级，你可以使用这个特性来复制稀有度逐渐增加的物品：在5级时是不寻常(Uncommon)，在11级时是稀有(Rare)，最后在17级时是非常稀有(Very Rare)的物品。

classFeature.name: Specialization
entries: 在1级时，选择以下最能代表你工匠的奥术研究和发明的专长之一：炼金术士 (Alchemist)，铠甲师 (Armorer)，战斗铁匠 (Battle Smith)，铸造师 (Forgewright)，或者魔杖使者 (Wandslinger)，每个专长的详细信息在职业末尾有介绍。
你的专长在1级时获得特性，然后在达到该职业的3级、5级、9级和15级时再次获得特性。

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: 在2级时，你可以利用你的工具和独特的魔法，从你赋予奥术力量的物品和工具中产生奇异而奇妙的法术效果。

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: 在2级时，你可以从{@filter Artificer spell list|spells|class=Alternate Artificer (LLAART)}中选择学习两个零度法术。在4级时，你可以学习另一个(%Artificer%)法术，而在10级时可以学习另一个。

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: Artificer（制造师）表格显示你有多少法术位来施放1级及更高级别的法术。要施放一个法术，你必须消耗一个等同于该法术等级或更高级别的法术位。当你完成一次长休后，你会恢复所有已消耗的法术位。
例如，如果你知道1级法术{@spell magic missile}，并且有一个1级和一个2级法术位可用，你可以使用任一法术位施放{@spell magic missile}。

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-level and Higher
entries: 你可以选择{@filter Artificer spell list|spells|class=Alternate Artificer (LLAART)}中的两个1级法术。制造师表中的"已知法术"栏显示了你学会更多制造师法术的时间。每个法术必须符合你拥有法术位的等级。例如，当你在这个职业中达到5级时，你可以学会一个新的1级或2级制造师法术。
当你在这个职业中获得一个等级时，你可以用你有法术位的另一个工匠法术来替换你已知的一个工匠法术。

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: 智力是你的铸师法术的施法能力，你利用奥术知识施放法术。当一个法术提到你的施法能力时，当你为一个铸师法术设定豁免 DC，或者当你进行一个铸师法术的法术攻击检定时，你使用你的智力。

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: 你必须使用你熟练的工匠工具、一套{@item artisan's tools|phb}或者一个带有你的附魔之一的物品作为你的造物师法术的施法焦点。
当你使用你的工匠工具时，你会知道{@spell mending}法术和{@spell identify}法术，但它们不计入你已知法术的数量。你可以使用你的工匠工具消耗一个法术位来施展辨识法术，或者作为仪式法术。

classFeature.name: Specialization Spells
entries: 每个专精都有一个专精法术列表，你在其描述中指定的铸师等级时学会这些法术。这些专精法术对你来说算作铸师法术，但它们不计入你已知法术的总数。

classFeature.name: Specialization Feature
entries: 在3级时，你获得了你的专长(Specialization)赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到4级时，你可以选择将一个能力值提高2点，或者将两个能力值提高1点。与正常规则一样，使用此特性不能将能力值提高到20以上。
如果你的DM允许使用专长(feats)，你可以选择取一个{@5etools feat|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Specialization Feature
entries: 在5级时，你获得了你的专长(Specialization)赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Adjustable Infusions
entries: 从6级开始，你可以随心所欲地调整你的{@filter Infusions|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAART:INF}。在短暂休息期间，你可以使用工匠工具，将你已知的一个附魔替换为你选择的另一个附魔，或者学会复制一个你能触摸到的魔法物品。在短暂休息结束时，你可以将新的附魔注入到你触摸到的物品中。如果需要符灵，你可以遵循符灵到你的附魔的正常规则。
一旦你以这种方式替换你已知的一个（Infusions Known）, 你必须完成一次长休才能再次这样做。

classFeature.name: Tool Expertise
entries: 很少有人能与工匠（Artificer）在使用所擅长的工具方面的天赋相匹敌。从6级开始，每当你进行一个需要使用你熟练的工具的能力检定时，你可以将你的熟练加值翻倍加到你的骰子点数上。

classFeature.name: Flash of Genius
entries: 从第7级开始，你的分析思维可以在瞬间提供强大的见解和建议。作为一次反应，当你或你能看到的另一个生物在30英尺内进行能力检定或豁免投掷时，你可以将你的智力调整值（最少+1）加到投掷结果上。
你可以使用这个特性的次数等于你的智力调整值（最少一次），当你完成一次长休后，你会恢复所有已用次数。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到8级时，你可以选择将一个能力值提高2点，或者将两个能力值提高1点。与常规规则相同，使用此特性不能将能力值提高到20以上。
如果你的DM允许使用专长(feats)，你可以选择取一个{@5etools feat|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Specialization Feature
entries: 在第9级时，你会获得你的专长(Specialization)赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Magic Item Mastery (4)
entries: You have gained a deep understanding of the inner workings of magic items, allowing you greater use of them. Starting at 10th level, you can attune to up to four magic items at once.
The number of magic items you can attune to at one time increases at 14th level (5 items) and at 18th level (6 items).

Finally, for you, crafting a magic item with a rarity of Common or Uncommon takes a quarter of the normal time and costs half the normal gold. When you reach 20th level, this bonus also applies to Rare and Very Rare magic items.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
如果你的DM允许使用专长(feats)，你可以选择取一个{@5etools feat|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Arcane Breakthrough
entries: Beginning at 14th level, your expert understanding of magic items allows you to attune to any magic item regardless of any alignment, class, race, spell, or level requirements.

classFeature.name: Magic Item Mastery (5)
entries: You have gained a deep understanding of the inner workings of magic items, allowing you greater use of them. Starting at 14th level, you can attune to up to five magic items at once.

classFeature.name: Specialization Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Specialization.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
如果你的DM允许使用专长(feats)，你可以选择取一个{@5etools feat|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Magic Item Mastery (6)
entries: You have gained a deep understanding of the inner workings of magic items, allowing you greater use of them. Starting at 18th level, you can attune to up to six magic items at once.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
如果你的DM允许使用专长(feats)，你可以选择取一个{@5etools feat|feats.html}。

classFeature.name: Soul of Artifice
entries: You imbue a spark of your own essence in the magic items you bear. At 20th level, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws for each magic item you are attuned to. In addition, if you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to end your attunement to one magic item or Infusion, causing you to drop to 1 hit point instead of 0.
Moreover, if you are killed, any object that bears one of your Infusions counts as part of your body for the purposes of any spell that would bring you back to life.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist
entries: Alchemy is a delicate art, tip the ratio of ingredients too far out of line and the effects could be disastrous. Alchemists are experts at combining exotic reagents to produce a variety of materials and effects. From healing droughts that can heal a wound in moments, to sticky goo that explodes when it comes in contact with flame. With the right reagents and a bit of luck, Alchemists use their wondrous Elixirs to give life to their allies and leech it away from their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}. If you are already proficient with alchemist's supplies, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

Moreover, while you have access to alchemist's supplies, you can use your action to cast the {@spell acid splash} cantrip, using Intelligence as your spellcasting modifier. When you gain the Spellcasting feature, acid splash counts as an artificer spell for you, but doesn't count against your total Cantrips Known.

subclassFeature.name: Homunculus
entries: Your alchemical experimentation has yielded for you a loyal Homunculus Servant. You determine its appearance, but its appearance has no effect on its abilities. It is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands to the best of its ability. It uses the {@creature Homunculus Servant|LLAART} stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in several places.

In combat, your Homunculus acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes is the Dodge action unless you use a bonus action to command it to take an action from its stat block, or another action. If you are incapacitated, your Homunculus can take any action it chooses. If you die, your Homunculus turns to ash after a number of minutes equal to your artificer level.
If your Homunculus has died within the last hour, you can touch it with alchemist's supplies and expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to return to life at its maximum hit points.
At the end of a long rest, you can make a new Homunculus Servant using your alchemist's supplies. If you already have a Homunculus from this feature, the first one turns to ash.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemist Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Elixirs
entries: As your knowledge of alchemy has grown, you have learned to create potent Elixirs that mimic certain spell effects:

entries.name: Elixir Infusion
entries: Elixir Infusions. Your total number of Infusions Known increases by one, but this extra Infusion must be from the list of {@filter Elixir Infusions|optionalfeatures|feature type=LLAART:ALC}.

Your total number of Infusions Known increases by one again 9th level and at 15th level in this class. Both of these additional Infusions must also be chosen from the list of Elixir Infusions at the end of this Specialization.

entries.name: Creating an Elixir
entries: Creating an Elixir. At the end of each long rest, you can use alchemist's supplies to create individual Tiny vials that contain a copy of each Elixir you know, without expending a spell slot. Elixirs produce the effect of their spell at its lowest level and become unusable at the end of your next long rest.
As an action, you can create another vial of an Elixir you know by expending the spell slot listed in its description. An Elixir can be used as part of the same action you create it.

entries.name: Using an Elixir
entries: As an action, any creature can drink an Elixir, administer an Elixir to a creature within its reach, or throw an Elixir at a point within 30 feet. When thrown, an Elixir produces its spell effect at the point of impact. If an Elixir spell requires concentration, the creature that drinks it must concentrate on the effect. Your Elixir spells use your artificer spell save DC and spellcasting modifier.

For example, if you learn the create minor elixir Infusion and choose {@spell grease} and {@spell sleep}, at the end of each long rest you prepare an elixir of grease, and an elixir of sleep. Creatures can then use these Elixirs to produce the spell effects.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Potions
entries: Whenever one of your Elixirs or an artificer spell cast by you deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, or restores hit points to a creature, you can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to one of the damage or healing rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Restorative Reagents
entries: You include revitalizing additives in all the Elixirs you create. When a creature uses one of your Elixirs on themselves or restores a creature's hit points with one, the target of the Elixir gains temporary hit points equal to your artificer level.

subclassFeature.name: Master Alchemist
entries: You have become a master among Alchemist artificers. You gain resistance to both acid and poison damage, and you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.
Moreover, you can create a copy of any Elixir you know as a bonus action on your turn. You must still expend a spell slot and follow all other rules for creating an Alchemical Elixir.

subclassFeature.name: Armorer
entries: Of all the Specializations that an artificer can pursue, that of the Armorer is the most defensively-minded. With a focus on becoming a bastion of magics and metal, Armorers modify a set of armor to function as their second skin. They focus their signature magic through this armor to unleash potent attacks and generate formidable arcane defenses. An Armorer views their armor as an extension of their body, and as they refine their magical abilities, inventor and armor become one.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and {@filter heavy armor|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=heavy armor}. If you are already proficient with smith's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Gauntlet
entries: You can forge for yourself a wondrous weapon of war known as an Arcane Gauntlet. At the end of a long rest, you can use smith's tools to create an Arcane Gauntlet, choosing for it to be a Lightning Cannon or Thunder Gauntlet. It is a simple weapon only usable by you, and you use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for its attack and damage rolls.
You can only have one Arcane Gauntlet at a time. Creating a second causes the magic of the first to immediately dispel.

entries.name: Lightning Cannon
entries: Your Arcane Gauntlet gains the ranged (90/300) property. On hit, it deals 1d6 lightning damage, and once per turn, when you hit with a Lightning Cannon attack, you can cause it to deal an additional 1d6 lightning damage.

entries.name: Thunder Gauntlet
entries: Your Arcane Gauntlet remains a melee weapon. On hit, it deals 1d8 thunder damage, and any target hit by this Gauntlet has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Armorer Spells
entries: Starting at 1st level, you learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Efreeti Magic table. The spell counts as a Artificer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of Artificer spells you know. These can't be replaced when you gain a Artificer level.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armor
entries: You expand the magic of your Arcane Gauntlet to encompass a full suit of armor. At the end of a long rest, you can use your smith's tools to transform a set of armor into Arcane Armor. This armor incorporates your Arcane Gauntlet, is only usable by you, and while wearing it you gain the following benefits:

items: If the set of armor normally has a Strength requirement, your Arcane Armor lacks this requirement for you.
You can use your Arcane Armor as a spellcasting focus.
Your Arcane Armor attaches to you and can't be removed against your will. It expands to cover your entire body, and functionally replaces any missing limbs or body parts.
You can don or doff your Arcane Armor as an action, and can retract or deploy the helmet as a bonus action.
You can use a bonus action to grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Armorer Adept
entries: You can use magical armor as Arcane Armor. Though, any innate magical bonuses to Armor Class from magic armor, Infusions, or other features don't stack. You must choose one.
Finally, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn, and you can cast one of your artificer cantrips in place of one of your attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Modular Armor
entries: Your Arcane Armor counts as multiple items for the purpose of your Infusions: armor (the chest piece), boots, helmet, and the gauntlets (weapon), and each item can bear one Infusion.
Also, your number of Infusions Known increases by 2, but these extra Infusions must be applied to your Arcane Armor.

subclassFeature.name: Master Armorer
entries: You have become a master of Armorer artifice. You gain the benefits listed below while wearing your Arcane Armor:

items: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
You adjust your Arcane Armor so that you have access to both your Lightning Launcher and Thunder Gauntlet.
Your Lightning Launcher now deals 2d6 damage, and your Thunder Gauntlet now deals 2d8 damage.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Smith
entries: A combination of protector and medic, Battle Smith artificers are experts at defending others and repairing both material and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths construct and modify their Steel Defender, a one-of-a-kind companion.

entries.subclassFeature: Tools of the Trade|Alternate Artificer|LLAART|Battle Smith|LLAART|1

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and in {@filter heavy armor|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=heavy armor}. If you are proficient in smith's tools, you gain proficiency in another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

entries.name: Construct and Creator
entries: Battle Smiths are famous for their Steel Defenders, which are as unique as the artificers that created them. Some resemble polished and sophisticated servants, while others serve as battlefield mounts.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Defender
entries: You have created for yourself a faithful construct, known as a Steel Defender. It is friendly to you and your allies and obeys your orders. Your Steel Defender's game statistics are found in the Steel Defender stat block, which uses your proficiency bonus (PB) in multiple places.

In combat, your Steel Defender acts during your turn. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but it only uses the Dodge action on its turn unless you use your bonus action to order it to take an action in its stat block, or another action. If you are incapacitated, your Steel Defender acts on its own.
If your Steel Defender has died within the last hour, you can touch it with your smith's tools and expend an artificer spell slot to return it to life with its maximum hit points.
At the end of a long rest, you can magically create a new Steel Defender with your smith's tools. When you do so, any previous Steel Defenders are immediately rendered inert.
Upon its creation, you choose the shape of your Steel Defender, which can affect its abilities in and out of combat:

items: {@creature Steel Defender (Humanoid)|LLAART|Humanoid}. Your Steel Defender is the size of a Medium humanoid creature. It is proficient with shields, and it has humanoid hands that it can use to perform basic tasks.

{@creature Steel Defender (Quadruped)|LLAART|Quadruped}. Your Steel Defender resembles a Large beast of your choice. Its speed increases by 10 feet, and it can be ridden as a mount by you as if it was a trained mount.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Smith Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

rows: {@spell circle of power}, {@spell mass cure wounds}

subclassFeature.name: Battle Ready
entries: You have trained to stand alongside your Steel Defender in battle. You can use your Intelligence in place of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls you make with magic weapons, or any weapon that bears one of your Infusions.

subclassFeature.name: Infusion Bearer
entries: You have designed your Steel Defender to bear your most potent Infusions. Your Steel Defender can bear any Infusion that is meant for boots, cloaks, gauntlets, helms, or suits of armor. Though, it can only bear one Infusion at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Upgrade
entries: You have improved the offensive capabilities of your Steel Defender. Choose one of the Minor Upgrades below:

entries.name: Minor Arcanum
entries: You imbue your Steel Defender with a 1st-level artificer spell with a casting time of one action. As a bonus action, you can order your Steel Defender to cast the imbued spell at 1st-level, using your spellcasting modifier. Your Steel Defender has a number of charges of the spell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and it regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Martial Offense
entries: The damage of your Steel Defender's Rend becomes 1d10, and when you command it to take the Rend action it can make two Rend attacks instead of one. It can replace either Rend attack with a grapple or shove.

subclassFeature.name: Adjustable Upgrades
entries: You can adjust your Steel Defender's Upgrades to face the challenges at hand. Each time you finish a long rest, you can use your smith's tools to replace one of your Steel Defender's Upgrades with another Upgrade gained at the same level.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Upgrade
entries: You can imbue your Steel Defender with wondrous abilities and features. Choose one of the Greater Upgrades below:

entries.name: Limited Sentience
entries: You improve the cognitive abilities of your Steel Defender. Its Intelligence score becomes a 10. It also gains proficiency with a set of tools of your choice and learns to speak, read, and write two languages of your choice.

entries.name: Modular Construction
entries: Your Steel Defender can bear up to two Infusions, though the Infusions must be meant for different types of objects. For example, your Steel Defender could be infused with an Infusion meant for a suit of armor and an Infusion meant for a helm, but not two Infusions that are both meant to be used on suits of armor.

entries.name: Reinforced Plating
entries: You improve the structure of your Steel Defender. It gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from all non-magical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Masterwork Upgrade
entries: You imbue your Steel Defender with wondrous abilities and powers. Choose one of the Masterwork Upgrades below:

entries.name: Arcane Ward
entries: Creatures of your choice within 15 feet of your Steel Defender are resistant to damage from spells.

entries.name: Self-Destruct
entries: You embed a powerful arcane explosive in your Steel Defender. As a bonus action, you can order your Steel Defender to self-destruct, destroying itself and forcing creatures within 20 feet to make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures take force damage equal to your Steel Defenders remaining Hit Dice on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. Once this feature is used, your Steel Defender cannot be revived until the end of your next long rest.

entries.name: Major Arcanum
entries: You imbue your Steel Defender with a 3rd-level artificer spell with a casting time of one action. As a bonus action, you can order your Steel Defender to cast the imbued spell at 3rd-level, using your spellcasting modifier.
Your Steel Defender has a number of charges of the spell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and it regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Forgewright
entries: While most artificers are primarily inventors that take up a life of adventure to test experiments in the field, those known as Forgewrights seek out battle for its own sake. Reveling in the thrill of combat, they combine their innovation with their skill as warriors to forge their signature Arcane Armament.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and {@item smith's tools|phb}. If you're already proficient with smith's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armament
entries: Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use smith's tools to transform one melee weapon you touch into your Arcane Armament. You can only have one Arcane Armament at a time, and enchanting a second causes the magic of the first to end. While you wield your Arcane Armament, you gain the benefits below.

items: You can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for attack and damage rolls with the weapon.
The weapon gains both the thrown (20/60) and returning properties. After you make a thrown weapon attack with your Arcane Armament, it instantly returns to your hand.
It counts as a magical weapon if it was not already.

subclassFeature.name: Forgewright Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Forge of War
entries: Your signature artifice enhances the power of your weapon. Any weapon attacks you make with your Arcane Armament score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
Also, your total number of Infusions Known increases by 1. However, this bonus Infusion must be applied to your Arcane Armament, and can be applied even if it was a magic weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Jolt
entries: When you hit a target with your Arcane Armament you can expend a spell slot to deal additional force damage to the target. The extra damage is 2d6 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d6 for each spell level higher than 1st, to a maximum of 6d6.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Arcane Jolt
entries: The magic of your Arcane Armament empowers its strikes. Each time you hit a creature with a weapon attack with your Arcane Armament you deal an additional 1d6 force damage.
This force damage does not count against the maximum amount of damage you can deal with your Arcane Jolt feature.

subclassFeature.name: Master Forgewright
entries: You have become a master among Forgewright artificers and can extend the power within your Arcane Armament to allies. As an action, you can hold aloft your Arcane Armament and choose a number of weapons equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) within 30 feet, one of which can be your Arcane Armament. For the next minute these weapons deal an additional 1d6 force damage on hit.

Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses of this feature left, you can expend an artificer spell slot of 3rd-level or higher to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Wandslinger
entries: Wandslingers use their ingenuity and artistic minds to craft wondrous arcane weapons. What they lack in flexibility and subtlety, they make up for in overwhelming arcane firepower. Wandslingers are marked by their signature Arcane Sidearm. For some, these are intricately carved wands or staffs, and for others, they are expertly crafted runic iron cannons.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with woodcarver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Sidearm
entries: You have constructed for yourself a Wandslinger's signature weapon. At the end of a long rest, you can use woodcarver's tools to craft an Arcane Sidearm. It resembles a Tiny object of your choosing, though its appearance has no effect on its abilities. Many Wandslingers craft Sidearms that resemble delicate wands, ornate rods, or even eldritch cannons.

Your Arcane Sidearm is a simple weapon with the ranged (120/300) property, and you use your Intelligence, instead of your Dexterity, for its attack and damage rolls. On hit, it deals force damage equal to 1d10 + your Intelligence modifier.
When you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level, your Arcane Sidearm can be used as a spellcasting focus by you.
You can only have one Arcane Sidearm at a time. Creating another Arcane Sidearm renders that magic of the first inert.

subclassFeature.name: Quickdraw
entries: You have honed your reflexes so that you can nearly always strike first. When you roll initiative and are not surprised or incapacitated, you can use your reaction to make one attack with your Arcane Sidearm, or another magic wand, rod, or staff that you are holding before any other creatures act.

subclassFeature.name: Wandslinger Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

rows: {@spell cone of cold}, {@spell wall of force}

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Duelist
entries: You have begun to master the signature abilities of an arcane duelist. As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can use your Arcane Sidearm to use one of the abilities listed below.
If one of these abilities forces a creature to make a saving throw, it does so against your artificer Spell save DC.

entries.name: Shocking Burst
entries: Your Arcane Sidearm conjures a burst of lightning at a point you can see within 60 feet, forcing creatures within 5 feet to make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures take 2d6 lightning damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success.

entries.name: Thunderous Blast
entries: Your Arcane Sidearm emits a blast of magic in an adjacent 15-foot cone. Any creatures in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 thunder damage.
Any Large or smaller creature that fails this saving throw is also knocked back 10 feet away from you in a straight line.

entries.name: Wandslinger's Ward
entries: Your Arcane Sidearm produces a field that grants you, or a creature of your choice within 10 feet of you, temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Spell Slinger
entries: You wield your Arcane Sidearm with deadly skill. When you use your action to make an attack with your Arcane Sidearm, you can make two attacks instead of just one. These attacks can target two targets or the same target.
As you gain artificer levels, the number of Arcane Sidearm attacks you make as part of a single action increases: at 11th level (3), and 17th level (4).

subclassFeature.name: Expert Duelist
entries: The amount of lightning or thunder damage dealt, or temporary hit points granted by all three Arcane Duelist bonus action features increases by 1d6.

subclassFeature.name: Master Wandslinger
entries: You have become a master of Wandslinger artifice. You gain the benefits listed below:

items: When you use your action to make an Arcane Sidearm attack, you can cast an artificer spell of 1st-level or higher as a bonus action on that turn.
When you cast an artificer spell and use your Arcane Sidearm as the spellcasting focus, you can choose for that spell to deal force damage in place of its normal damage type.
As a reaction when you, or a creature within 10 feet is targeted by a spell, you you can grant all creatures within 10 feet of you three-quarters cover against that spell.
You can choose for your Arcane Duelist bonus actions to deal force damage in place of their normal damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aeronaut
entries: The most dangerous Specialization an artificer can pursue is that of the Aeronaut. Constantly carrying out dangerous trials in their pursuit of mechanical flight, these pioneering minds will risk anything to complete the perfect flying machine. No setback or injury can dampen the spirits of a true Aeronaut.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item woodcarver's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with woodcarver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Aeronaut's Harness
entries: When you adopt this Specialization, you craft for yourself the signature safety harness of an Aeronaut. You learn the {@optfeature skyfall harness|LLAART:E} Infusion, it doesn't count against your total number of Infusions Known, and you can ignore its level prerequisite.
However, until you reach 5th level in this class, only you can don the skyfall harness you create with this Infusion. For all other creatures, this Infusion fails to function.

subclassFeature.name: Aeronaut Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Flying Machine
entries: You have constructed the signature invention of an Aeronaut, the Flying Machine. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use woodcarver's tools to craft a Flying Machine. Some Flying Machines include wings made of canvas, rotating blades, or even elemental engines.

Your Flying Machine can only be used by you and can be attached to your skyfall harness. While you wear your Flying Machine, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for spells. It also grants you a flying speed of 20 feet, and you can hover.
At certain artificer levels, this flying speed increases: at 5th level (30 feet), at 9th level (40 feet), and at 15th level (60 feet).
You can only maintain one Flying Machine, and creating a second one causes the magic of any others to dispel.

subclassFeature.name: Airborne Assault
entries: Your Flying Machine allows you to attack foes from unorthodox positions and catch enemies unaware. When you are flying at least 5 feet off the ground, your weapon attacks and artificer spell attacks deal an additional 1d8 bonus damage on hit.
At 15th level, this bonus damage becomes 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Aerial Maneuvers
entries: You have greatly improved the maneuverability of your Flying Machine. While you are flying at least 5 feet off the ground with your Flying Machine, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your bonus action to Dash.
You gain a bonus to your Dexterity ability checks and saving throws equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Master Aeronaut
entries: You have become a master Aeronaut. While you are flying at least 5 feet off the ground in your Flying Machine, and are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist
entries: For centuries chroniclers have sought the best way to store vast amounts of information. While most were satisfied with scrolls, the Archivists looked for something greater. In their research, they learned to store libraries worth of information in objects, awakening the first Artificial Minds. Working with these wondrous Minds, Archivists wield the limitless power of these arcane intelligences to drive their research forward.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item calligrapher's supplies|phb} and learn to speak, read, and write two languages of your choice. If you are already proficient with calligrapher's supplies, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Artificial Mind
entries: You learn to awaken mundane objects. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use calligrapher's supplies to awaken an Artificial Mind in a Tiny nonmagical object you touch. While the object is awakened, it is a magical item that requires your attunement and can be used as a spellcasting focus for any artificer spells you learn.
Should you awaken a second Artificial Mind, any previous Artificial Minds are instantly dispelled. While attuned to the awakened Artificial Mind, you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Magical Telephony
entries: You can communicate telepathically with any creature carrying one of your infused items within a 1-mile radius. The creature can also respond telepathically.

entries.name: Skill Proficiencies
entries: Depending on the material of the object you awaken, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice from the corresponding column on the table below.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Information Overload
entries: Your Artificial Mind can bombard other minds with psychic information. As an action, you can force a creature you can see within 30 feet to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, it takes 1d8 psychic damage and has disadvantage on the first attack roll it makes before the start of your next turn.
As you gain artificer levels, the psychic damage increases: at 5th level (2d8), at 11th level (3d8), and at 17th level (4d8).

subclassFeature.name: Acute Overload
entries: The power of your Artificial Mind has increased. Whenever a creature fails its save against Information Overload you can expend an artificer spell slot to increase the psychic damage. The damage increases by 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st-level.
Also, when you deal psychic damage using your Artificial Mind as a spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Improved Consciousness
entries: When you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell while you are attuned to your Artificial Mind, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
Moreover, your Artificial Mind doesn't count against the total number of magical objects you can be attuned to.

subclassFeature.name: Master Archivist
entries: You have become a master of Archivist artifice. As an action on your turn, you can transform into pure information and teleport to an unoccupied space that you can see within 60 feet, or an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a creature or object bearing one of your artificer Infusions.

subclassFeature.name: Biomancer
entries: While most artificers are content with mechanical invention, some see biology, the science of living things, as an area rife with potential. Biomancers are those who use their talents to supplement their own anatomy and create life. Combining necromancy and transmutation magic, Biomancers see all living things as prototypes that can be magically evolved.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item leatherworker's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with leatherworker's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Biomancer Golem
entries: You can use the magic of your artifice to create a facsimile of life. You learn the {@spell find familiar} spell, but until you gain the Spellcasting feature you can only cast the spell as a ritual. When you cast find familiar, your familiar is known as a Biomancer Golem, and it has the following changes:

items: The material component is 1 pound of organic matter.
It is a monstrosity (instead of a celestial, fey, or fiend).
It has additional hit points equal to your artificer level.

subclassFeature.name: Biomancer Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Modular Biology
entries: You can use your knowledge of arcane biology to enhance your physical form. At the end of each long rest, you can use your leatherworker's tools to modify your body in one of the ways below, which lasts until the end of your next long rest:

entries.name: Amphibious Physiology
entries: You develop gills and webbing between your digits. You can breathe both air and water, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Bestial Senses
entries: You enhance your sense of hearing and smell to rival wild beasts. You are considered proficient in Perception if you were not already, and you gain a bonus to Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing, sight, or smell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

entries.name: Resilient Hide
entries: Your flesh has grown thicker and knotted. So long as you aren't wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Intelligence modifier + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Vestigial Limb
entries: You grow a shrunken limb that resembles your other limbs. Its reach is 5 feet, and it can lift a total number of pounds equal to twice your Intelligence score. It can't use weapons or shields nor can it do anything that requires precision, such as using tools.

subclassFeature.name: Augmented Flesh
entries: Your own altered form can merge with that of your Golem to enhance your abilities. As an action, you can touch your Golem and merge with it, gaining the benefits below:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to the Biomancer Golem's remaining hit points + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).
Any movement speeds you have increase by 10 feet.
You can use Intelligence, in place of Strength, for Strength attack rolls, damage rolls, ability checks, or saving throws.
You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
As a bonus action, you can expend an artificer spell slot to gain temporary hit points equal to 5 times the slot's level.

entries: You remain merged with your Golem until your temporary hit points from this feature are depleted, at which point your Golem is destroyed and you return to your normal form.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Evolution
entries: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and at the end of each long rest, you can use leatherworker's tools to modify your body with two Modular Biology features.
When you reach 15th level in this class, you can modify yourself with any three Modular Biology features at once.

subclassFeature.name: Master Biomancer
entries: You have become a master amongst Biomancers. Whenever you target a creature with one of your Biomancer Spells, you can grant one target of that spell temporary hit points equal to your artificer level + your Intelligence modifier.
In addition, when merged with your Biomancer Golem, you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Chronothief
entries: For those that pursue the magic of artifice, no area of study is too dangerous. Perhaps against their better judgment, some artificers choose to experiment with Chronomancy, the magic of time. Known as Chronothieves, these bold artificers are marked by their signature Chronometers, a wondrous object that they use to steal moments and adjust the flow of time.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item jeweler's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with jeweler's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.
In addition, you are always aware of the exact time while you are on your home plane of existence. Once you spend a full day on another plane you gain this benefit there as well.

entries.name: Chronothieves & Dunamancy Magic
entries: If your table uses the Dunamancy magic found in Explorer's Guide to Wildemount, your Chronothief is considered familiar with such secret magic.
Moreover, when you gain the Chronothief Spells feature at 2nd level, you can choose to replace the spells you would normally gain from that feature with any Dunamancy spell of the same spell level.

subclassFeature.name: Chronometer
entries: You have learned to construct a wondrous device that marks you as a Chronothief. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use your jeweler's tools to construct a Chronometer, which appears as a Tiny object of your choice. Chronometers often resemble tiny hourglasses filled with sand, intricate contraptions, or pocket watches.
When you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level, your Chronometer can be used as a spellcasting focus by you.
You can only have one Chronometer at a time, and creating a second causes the magic of the first to instantly dispel.

Your Chronometer has a number of Charges equal to twice your Intelligence modifier and regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest. While holding your Chronometer, you can expend 1 Charge to use one of the abilities below:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: As a bonus action, you can increase the speed of a creature you can see within 60 feet by a total number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet) until the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: As a bonus action, you can force a creature you can see within 60 feet to make a Charisma saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier). On a failed save, its speed is reduced by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet) until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Chronothief Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Chronometer
entries: You have come to a deeper understanding of chronomancy magic, growing your Chronometer's power. You can expend 1 Charge of your Chronometer to use the following abilities:

entries.name: Rush
entries: When you roll initiative and aren't surprised, you can replace the d20 for your initiative roll with your artificer level.

entries.name: Slip
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can force them to re-roll as a reaction. You can use this reaction after the creature rolls, but before you know if it succeeded or failed.

entries.name: Warp
entries: As a bonus action, you can switch places with a creature you can see within 60 feet, each instantly teleporting to the other's space. Unwilling creatures must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be forced to switch places.

subclassFeature.name: Stolen Moments
entries: Your Chronometer can capture time for later use. When you successfully paralyze, stun, or reduce a creature's speed to 0 with an artificer spell or one of your Chronothief abilities, your Chronometer regains 1d4 of its expended charges.
Also, you can use a bonus action to expend an artificer spell slot and cause your Chronometer to regain expended charges equal to the level of the spell slot you expend.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Chronomancy
entries: Your understanding and control over time magic has greatly increased. Your Chronometer improves in the following ways:

entries.name: Accelerate
entries: Opportunity attacks against the target creature have disadvantage until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Decelerate
entries: You can spend an additional Charge to double the speed reduction. If this feature reduces a target's speed to 0, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of its next turn.

entries.name: Rush
entries: You also gain a bonus to your initiative roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Master Chronothief
entries: You have become a master Chronothief. While holding your Chronometer, you can use your action to overload the device, expending all of its remaining Charges, to cast {@spell time stop}.
Once you use this feature you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast time stop in this way again.

subclassFeature.name: Composer
entries: Behind every great musician, every standing ovation, every sold-out concert, there is most often Composer who put quill to parchment and penned the notes. These great minds are unlike other bards and entertainers, Composers take a more cerebral approach to music. They are masters of patterns and repetition, and when they apply their analytical mind to a problem it is only a matter of time before they find a solution.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with smith's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.
In addition, if you spend at least 1 minute practicing with a musical instrument, you are considered proficient with that musical instrument until the end of your next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Musical Apparatus
entries: You have designed a wondrous new musical instrument. Over the course of 1 hour, which can be during a short or long rest, you can use smith's tools to construct a Musical Apparatus of your own design. You are proficient with your Apparatus as a musical instrument, and whenever you make an ability check that uses your Musical Apparatus, you can add double your proficiency bonus to the result of your roll.
When you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level your Musical Apparatus can be used as a spellcasting focus.
You can only have one Musical Apparatus at a time. If you create a second, the previous Apparatus becomes unusable.

subclassFeature.name: Composer Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Weaponized Apparatus
entries: You can modify your Musical Apparatus to be used for both entertainment and combat. When you create an Apparatus, it gains one of the following features of your choice:

entries.name: Raucous Blast
entries: As an action, you can use your Apparatus to make a spell attack against a creature within 60 feet that can hear you. On hit, the creature takes 1d8 thunder damage and is deafened until the beginning of your next turn.
This thunder damage increases by 1d8 at 5th level (2d8), and again at 11th level (3d8), and at 17th level (4d8).

entries.name: Ringing Strike
entries: Your Apparatus is a simple weapon with the versatile property, that deals 1d8 (1d10) bludgeoning damage on hit. You are considered proficient with it, and you can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength, for attack and damage rolls with the Apparatus.

You also learn the {@spell booming blade|xge} cantrip. It counts as an artificer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known. When you cast booming blade, you must use your Apparatus as the spell's material component.

subclassFeature.name: Thunderous Note
entries: When you use your Apparatus to deal thunder damage, you can expend a spell slot to knock a Large or smaller creature back with a thunderous burst of sound. The target is knocked back 10 feet for a 1st-level spell slot, and an additional 10 feet back for each spell level higher than 1st-level.
Also, whenever you deal thunder damage you can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Resonant Frequency
entries: As an action, you can play a note on your Apparatus to cause a creature of your choice within 10 feet to resonate with undetectable vibrations for 1 hour. The next time it is hit with a melee attack, its attacker must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the attacker takes 2d8 thunder damage and cannot take reactions until the beginning of its next turn. On a successful save, the attacker takes half damage.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Composer
entries: You have mastered the theory and applications of musical artifice, becoming a master. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to thunder damage and being deafened.
Your Musical Apparatus gains both Weaponized effects.
Your Thunderous Note feature can affect Huge or smaller creatures. Large or smaller creatures that fail the saving throw fall prone at the end of their forced movement.
The damage of Resonant Frequency becomes 4d8.

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoneer
entries: While most artificers focus on developing a single invention, Dungeoneers use their ingenuity to weaponize the mundane. They use basic adventuring gear to construct defensive traps, puzzles, and structures that can repel all but the hardiest of adventurers and monsters. Dungeoneers will set out for an adventure to analyze the traps that guard tombs and temples.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with both {@item carpenter's tools|phb} and {@item mason's tools}. f you are already proficient with either set of tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

In addition, you gain proficiency with improvised weapons and can use your Intelligence, in place of Strength or Dexterity, for all of your attack and damage rolls with improvised weapons. Dungeoneers are known for crafting strange weapons made from adventuring supplies.

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoneer Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

rows: {@spell glyph of warding}, {@spell leomund's tiny hut}
{@spell guardian of faith}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere}

subclassFeature.name: Dungeoncraft
entries: At the end of a long rest, you craft a number of objects from the Dungeoncraft Objects table equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). These objects appear as mundane versions of those objects but turn to ash at the end of your next long rest. You can also craft the normal versions of Dungeoncraft Objects in one-quarter of the normal time.
If an object you craft with this feature forces a creature to make a saving throw, it uses your artificer Spell Save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, rather than once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your artificer cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Improvisation
entries: Damage you deal with improvised weapon attacks and your Dungeoncraft Objects is magical for the sake of overcoming resistances and immunities to non-magical damage.

In addition, you can cast each of your Dungeoneer Spells once without providing their material components. Once you do so, you must provide the material components of the spell each subsequent time you cast it, until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master Dungeoneer
entries: You have become a master of Dungeoneering artifice. Whenever a creature makes a saving throw to resist one of your Dungeoncraft Objects or the effects of your Dungeoneer Spells, it has disadvantage on its saving throw.

You also learn to cast a ritual version of both {@spell passwall} and {@spell wall of stone}. They count as artificer spells for you, and when you cast them as a ritual you don't need to expend a spell slot, but the casting time is 1 hour. The structures you create with these spells become permanent at the end of the ritual.
When you learn passwall and wall of stone as Dungeoneer Spells at 17th level, you can cast them normally or as a ritual.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced
entries: Where most artificers develop objects of wondrous power, those known as Enhanced bring their great intellect to bear by modifying their own bodies. They replace and improve their own limbs with arcane enhancements, forever striving to create a more perfect self. Enhanced artificers are known for their impressive, and deadly, combat Enhancements.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb} and {@filter heavy armor|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=heavy armor}. If you are already proficient with smith's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Blade Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your arms to bear a hidden blade. It is a simple melee weapon with the finesse property that deals 1d8 slashing damage on hit and has the following abilities:

items: It is completely concealed within your arm unless you use a bonus action to activate or retract your blade.
It can bear one Infusion meant for a melee weapon.
You can use your Intelligence, in place of your Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls of your blade.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Enhancements
entries: You gain one Enhancement of your choice from the list below. They can be attached in place of a missing body part, or over a body part.
When you gain an artificer level you can switch replace your Enhancement with another Enhancement of your choice.
As you gain artificer levels, your body can bear additional Enhancements at one time: at 5th level (2), 9th level (3), and at 15th level (4).

entries.name: Mobility Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your legs. You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on each of your turns.

entries.name: Nimble Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your hands. You add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to any Dexterity checks you make that involve your modified hand.

entries.name: Power Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your arms. You can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to any Strength checks you make that involve your modified arm.

entries.name: Visual Enhancement
entries: You modify one of your eyes. You can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to any checks you make that rely on your sense of sight.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Enhancement
entries: You have improved your modifications to further augment your combat abilities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.
Each of your Enhancements can bear a single Infusion usually meant for the following objects: Mobility (boots), Nimble (gauntlets), Power (armor), Visual (helm, goggles).
Your Blade counts as magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Enhancements
entries: Your number of Infusions Known increases by 1, but this additional Infusion must be applied to an Enhancement.
The damage of your blade attacks also becomes 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Master Enhanced
entries: Choose one of your Enhancements to become a Masterwork Enhancement, granting you the additional benefits below. Each time you finish a long rest, you can replace your Masterwork Enhancement with another of your choice.

entries.name: Blade Masterwork
entries: Your Blade Enhancement weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

entries.name: Mobile Masterwork
entries: When you take the Dash action you are immune to opportunity attacks and you can move along vertical surfaces and liquids without falling during the move.

entries.name: Nimble Masterwork
entries: When you make a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

entries.name: Power Masterwork
entries: When you make a Strength check with your modified arm, you treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

entries.name: Visual Masterwork
entries: When you make a check that relies on your sense of sight, you treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Machinist
entries: While some artificers spend their lives perfecting one solitary creation, Machinist artificer value quantity over quality. They are known for creating their signature Automatons, small clockwork men that are created for a single, but temporary purpose. Armed with their tools, and an army of strange and wondrous servants, Machinists are ready for any challenge.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item smith's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with smith's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Automatons
entries: You learned to craft unique mechanical servants known as Automatons. At the end of each long rest, you can use your smith's tools to craft a Small Automaton in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. This Automaton has the abilities of the Agent model detailed further on.

Automatons are magical constructs with an Armor Class equal to 12 + your Intelligence modifier and hit points equal to your artificer level + your Intelligence modifier. When they make an ability check or a saving throw, its ability scores are 10 (+0). If {@spell mending} is cast on one, it regains 2d6 hit points. It disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points or after 1 hour.

In order to create an additional Automaton before the end of your next long rest, you must expend an artificer spell slot of 1st-level or higher to create one. You can only have a single operational Automaton at any one time. Creating a second Automaton causes any previous ones to instantly fall apart.

Your Automatons can do nothing on their own. However, you can use a bonus action on your turn to activate one of your Automatons so long as you are within 60 feet of it. As part of this bonus action, you can also cause your Automation to move up to 25 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Machinist Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

rows: {@spell cloud of daggers}, {@spell cordon of arrows}

subclassFeature.name: Innovative Models
entries: You have improved your craft. Whenever you create an Automaton, choose one of the Automaton models below:

entries.name: Agent Automaton
entries: When activated, you see and hear through the Automaton, so long as you are within 100 feet of it. You are deaf and blind to your senses until you end this link as a bonus action.

entries.name: Anchor Automaton
entries: When activated, the Automaton latches onto a target within 5 feet, reducing the target's speed by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet).

entries.name: Armor Automaton
entries: When activated, the Automaton attaches itself to a willing creature within 5 feet. While attached, that creature's Armor Class cannot be less than 13 + your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Artisan Automaton
entries: This Automaton is proficient with one set of tools, and when activated, it makes an ability check with its tool set, and adds your intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to its roll.

entries.name: Assault Automaton
entries: When activated, the Automaton makes a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet. On hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Conduit
entries: You can channel your signature artificer magic through your Automatons. When you cast an artificer spell, you can choose for the spell to originate from an Automaton of your choice, instead of yourself, so long as you are within 60 feet of it.

subclassFeature.name: Automated Army
entries: You now create two Automatons of your choice at the end of each long rest without expending a spell slot, and you can activate up to two Automatons with the same bonus action.
At 15th level, you can create and control up to three.

subclassFeature.name: Efficient Artifice
entries: Whenever you expend an artificer spell slot to create an Automaton, you create a number of Automatons equal to the level of the spell slot expended. You cannot use this feature to exceed the maximum number of Automatons you can control.

subclassFeature.name: Master Machinist
entries: You have become a master of Machinist artifice. When you are forced to make a saving throw or are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to switch places with one of your Automatons within 60 feet. The Automaton then becomes the target of the attack or saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer
entries: Though all artificers have their quirks, Puppeteers tend to be the strangest subset of arcane inventors. They dedicate their research and intellect towards mastery of manipulation and control of other creatures through the use of their Marionette Strings. Often found literally pulling the strings from behind the scenes, these strange artificers prefer to empower their allies rather than risk their own lives on the front lines.

subclassFeature.name: Tools of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item weaver's tools|phb}. If you are already proficient with weaver's tools, you instead gain proficiency with another set of {@item artisan's tools|phb} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Threads
entries: You have constructed for yourself arcane threads that you can manipulate with magic. You learn the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip, and when you gain the Spellcasting feature at 2nd level, it doesn't count against your total number of Cantrips Known. When you cast thorn whip it has the following changes:

items: You must use weaver's tools as the spellcasting focus.
You can choose for the spell not to damage a creature.

You can target objects and creatures. If the object is smaller than you and is not being worn or carried, it is pulled up to 30 feet to you. If the object is larger than you, you can pull yourself up to 30 feet toward the object.

subclassFeature.name: Puppeteer Spells
entries: You learn certain spells at the artificer levels noted in the table below. These don't count against your total number of Spells Known and can't be switched upon gaining a level.

subclassFeature.name: Marionette Strings
entries: You can use your strange artifice to help and control. While holding weaver's tools, you can use an action to cause your Strings to fly and attach to a willing creature within 30 feet.

While a creature is attached to your Strings, you gain the features listed below. Your Marionette Strings detach after 1 minute, if you use a bonus action to detach them, or if you and the attached creature are ever more than 30 feet apart.

entries.name: Corrected Strike
entries: When the attached creature makes a melee attack, you can use your reaction to have them re-roll their attack roll, and they must use the new roll. You must use this reaction before you know if the attack hits or misses.

entries.name: Channel Spell.
entries: As an action on your turn, you can cast an artificer spell as if it originated from the attached creature. If the spell requires concentration, you must concentrate on it.

entries.name: Strands of Guidance
entries: When the attached creature makes an ability check using a skill that you are proficient in, they add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to their roll.

entries.name: Strange Movement
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the attached creature a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 5 feet). This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Strikes
entries: The control you can exert through your Strings grows. As a reaction when the creature attached to your Strings makes an attack, you can cause them to make one additional attack.

subclassFeature.name: Nimble Fingers
entries: You can have up to two creatures attached to your Strings at one time. You must have a free hand to control each creature. The two creatures can be any distance apart from each other, so long as they remain within the range of your Strings.
In addition, the length of your Marionette Strings, and the range of all of your Puppeteer abilities increases to 60 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Master Puppeteer
entries: You have become a master Puppeteer. As an action, you can use your weaver's tools to cast {@spell Otto's Irresistible Dance}, without expending a spell slot, or requiring concentration. However, you can only have once instance of this spell active at a time, and the spell requires one of your free hands to maintain.
Once you cast Irresistible Dance this way, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Arm Launcher
entries: This tiny magical launcher can be loaded with a Tiny object, including but not limited to; ball bearings, a vial of acid, or holy water. As a bonus action, the wearer can activate the launcher and make a ranged weapon attack at a target up to 20 feet away. The launcher can be reloaded as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Arcane Focus
entries: This item grants the user +1 bonus to spell attack rolls, and they can ignore half cover when making spell attacks.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

item: A rod, staff or wand (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Defense
entries: This item grants the user +1 bonus to their armor class while wearing (armor) or wielding (shield) this infused item.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

item: A suit of armor or a shield

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Weapon
entries: This magic weapon grants the user a +1 bonus to any attack and damage rolls they make with this infused weapon.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Belt
entries: When worn, this magic belt reduces the user to one-tenth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.
At 11th level, it reduces the wearer to one-hundredth of their weight without decreasing their physical abilities.

item: A belt or a cloak (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Featherweight Weapon
entries: This magic weapon loses the heavy property if it had it. If it did not have the heavy property, it gains the light property.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A heavy or two-handed weapon (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Goggles of Clearsight
entries: While wearing these goggles, the wearer can see through areas that are lightly obscured by magical or mundane phenomena without disadvantage on Perception checks.
In addition, the wearer no longer suffers the negative effects of the Sunlight Sensitivity trait, and they have advantage on saving throws to resist becoming blinded.

item: A pair of goggles or glasses

optionalfeature.name: Power Whip
entries: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and its damage die becomes a 1d8.
This bonus increases at 11th level (+2) and 17th level (+3).

optionalfeature.name: Repeating Shot
entries: This magic weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition into the weapon it produces its own, creating magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack. The ammunition vanishes after it either hits or misses.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Returning Weapon
entries: After making a ranged attack this magic weapon, regardless if the attack hits or misses its target, it instantaneously returns to its wielder's hand.
At 11th level this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A weapon with the thrown property

optionalfeature.name: Homing Weapon
entries: The wielder of this magic weapon ignores the disadvantage imposed when attacking at the weapon's long range.
At 11th level it gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus becomes +2 at 17th level.

item: A weapon with the ranged or thrown property

optionalfeature.name: Immovable Boots
entries: When the wearer is standing on a flat surface, it can use an action to activate the boots, magically fixing the wearer in place. Until the wearer uses an action to deactivate the boots, they do not move, even if they are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, separating the boots from the surface on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Infiltrator Armor
entries: This magic suit of armor retains its weight but is formfitting and wearable under clothes. The wearer of this armor has advantage on any Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
If this armor normally imposes disadvantage on Stealth checks, the advantage and disadvantage cancel each other.

optionalfeature.name: Light Blade
entries: While grasping the object, the wielder can use a bonus action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence, or disappear, from the end of this object. While the blade exists, this magic item is considered a simple melee weapon with the finesse property, and it deals 1d8 radiant damage on hit.
The luminous blade emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet beyond that radius.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A sword hilt or wand (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Mind Sharpener
entries: This item can send a jolt to the wearer to refocus their mind. The item has 4 charges. When the wearer fails a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, they can use their reaction to spend 1 of the item's charges to succeed instead. The item regains all expended charges at dawn.

item: A suit of armor or robes

optionalfeature.name: Minor Arcane Item
entries: You imbue this object with a minor amount of arcane power. Each time you imbue this Infusion into an object, you choose a 1st-level artificer spell you know to imbue. A creature that holds the item can cast the spell imbued within, using the spell's normal casting time and your spellcasting ability.
If the spell requires concentration, that creature holding the item must concentrate on the spell for its duration.
This item holds a number of charges of the imbued spell equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and it regains all expended charges each day at dawn.

item: a Tiny item or tool (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, the wielder can cause this weapon to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius, and dim light 30 feet beyond that. The wielder can extinguish the light as a bonus action.

This magical weapon has 4 charges. When its wielder hits a creature with this weapon, it can expend 1 charge and force its target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is blinded until the beginning of your next turn. This weapon regains all expended charges at dawn.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Gauntlets
entries: These magical gauntlets have 4 charges. When their wearer hits a creature with an unarmed strike or gauntlet attack, it can expend 1 charge and force a Large or smaller target to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked back 15 feet in a straight line. These gauntlets regain all of their expended charges at dawn.
At 11th level, this weapon grants a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

item: A pair of gloves or gauntlets (requires attunement)

optionalfeature.name: Repulsion Shield
entries: This magic shield has 4 charges. When the wielder is hit by a melee attack, they can force a Large or smaller attacker to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is knocked back 15 feet in a straight line and falls prone. The shield regains all of its expended charges at dawn.
At 11th level this magic shield grants a +1 bonus to Armor Class. This Armor Class bonus increases to +2 at 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Armor of Magical Strength
entries: This magical armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class, and its wearer can also use its Intelligence, in place of Strength, for Strength-based ability checks or saving throws.

This armor also has 4 charges. As a reaction when the wearer would be knocked prone or moved against their will, they can expend 1 charge to remain standing or not move. The armor regains all of its expended charges at dawn.
At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

optionalfeature.name: Boots of the Winding Path
entries: The wearer of these magical boots can use a bonus action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

optionalfeature.name: Chameleon Armor
entries: This armor grants its wearer a +1 bonus to its Armor Class.

This armor also has 4 charges. While wearing this armor the wearer can use an action to expend charges and cast one of the following spells, targeting only themselves: invisibility (2 charges) or greater invisibility (4 charges). This magical armor regains all of its expended charges daily at dawn.
At 17th level, this armor grants a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Weapon
entries: You infuse this magic weapon with elemental energy. Upon infusion, choose a command word and one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning. As a bonus action, the wielder can speak the weapon's command word and cause elemental energy to burst forth from the weapon until the command word is spoken again. On hit, the weapon deals an additional 1d6 of the chosen elemental damage.
